headline: Sector Update: Financial Stocks Rise Late Afternoon
summary: Financial stocks rose in late Wednesday afternoon trading with the NYSE Financial Index gaining 0.1%

headline: Senate Report Blasts Private Equity’s Role in Healthcare
summary: A U.S. Senate committee accused private-equity healthcare investors of choosing profits over patient care, adding a prominent voice to those claiming Wall Street is putting the medical system at risk.

raw.headline: Senate Report Blasts Private Equity’s Role in Healthcare
raw.summary: A U.S. Senate committee accused private-equity healthcare investors of choosing profits over patient care, adding a prominent voice to those claiming Wall Street is putting the medical system at risk.

headline: Billionaire Investor Leon Black in Talks to Anchor Bid for Britain’s Telegraph
summary: The Apollo Global Management co-founder could help fund a near-$700 million takeover by New York Sun owner Dovid Efune.

raw.headline: Billionaire Investor Leon Black in Talks to Anchor Bid for Britain’s Telegraph
raw.summary: The Apollo Global Management co-founder could help fund a near-$700 million takeover by New York Sun owner Dovid Efune.

headline: Apollo’s Private Equity Capital Markets Head Manin Has Left Firm
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Apollo Global Management Inc.’s head of private equity capital markets, Matthew Manin, has left the firm to pursue another opportunity, according to people with knowledge of the matter, who asked not to be identified discussing private information. headline: Billionaire Leon Black in talks to lead acquisition of the Telegraph, WSJ reports
summary: Leon Black, co-founder and former CEO of Apollo Global Management, is in talks to become the anchor investor in the acquisition of the Telegraph, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday. ...
